title: Why do women binge drink when estrogen surges? Study explains - The Times of India
summary:
Why do women binge drink when estrogen surges? Study explains

Publication Date: Not available Source: Times of India

This article explores the psychological and biological factors that contribute to increased binge drinking among women during periods of elevated estrogen levels.

  • The study emphasizes the hormonal influences on behavior.
  • It discusses the motivations behind binge drinking in the context of social and emotional factors.
  • Findings suggest a link between estrogen surges and alcohol consumption patterns in women.
"Understanding these patterns can help in addressing addiction and public health strategies."

In conclusion, recognizing the interplay between estrogen and binge drinking behaviors is crucial for developing targeted interventions.

title: 'Roads Like Priyanka Gandhi's Cheeks': BJP Leader Bidhuri's Remark Draws Congress Ire - News18
summary:
BJP Leader Ramesh Bidhuri's Comment About Priyanka Gandhi Sparks Outrage

Date: January 05, 2025, Source: News18

A political stir erupted after BJP’s Ramesh Bidhuri made an inappropriate comment regarding Priyanka Gandhi, stating that future roads will be like her cheeks if his party wins.

  • The remark drew immediate backlash from Congress, which announced plans to file an FIR against Bidhuri.
  • Delhi BJP chief Virendraa Sachdeva advised leaders to refrain from making derogatory remarks about women.
  • In his defense, Bidhuri later expressed regret and retracted his statement.
  • Congress labeled the BJP as anti-women and demanded accountability from its leadership.
“If anyone is hurt by my remark, I express regret over it and I take my words back…” - Ramesh Bidhuri

The incident reflects ongoing tensions and challenges in political discourse regarding gender sensitivity.
newTitle: BJP Leader Ramesh Bidhuri's Comment About Priyanka Gandhi Sparks Outrage

title: Adequate calcium intake, exercise crucial for young adults to prevent osteoporosis, say experts - The Hindu
summary:
Experts Emphasize Calcium and Exercise to Prevent Osteoporosis in Young Adults

Date: January 05, 2025 06:27 pm IST

Source: The Hindu

Experts have emphasized that adequate calcium intake, regular physical activity, and avoiding detrimental habits are essential for preventing osteoporosis among young adults, as discussed in a recent webinar.

  • Adequate calcium intake and exercise are crucial for preventing bone loss.
  • Risk factors for osteoporosis include age, low body weight, and smoking.
  • Modern lifestyles contribute to decreased calcium intake and exercise.
  • Treatment options include bisphosphonates and hormone therapy for specific groups.
“Osteoporosis occurs when the balance between bone resorption and bone remodelling is disrupted, leading to decreased bone mass.” - Dr. Chaitanya

In conclusion, maintaining a healthy lifestyle and nutrient intake is vital for bone health, especially in young adults.
newTitle: Experts Emphasize Calcium and Exercise to Prevent Osteoporosis in Young Adults

title: Hyderabad’s famous doctor says HMPV is not a novel virus, eases fears about China outbreak - The Economic Times
summary:
Hyderabad Doctor Addresses HMPV Concerns Amid China Outbreak

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Deccan Chronicle

In the context of rising concerns over a Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV) outbreak in China, Dr. Ranga Reddy Burri reassures that HMPV is not a novel virus and emphasizes its typical mild impact.

  • HMPV primarily leads to flu-like symptoms lasting 2-5 days.
  • It can cause severe respiratory illness in vulnerable populations.
  • No cases of HMPV reported in India thus far.
  • Many circulating reports are sensationalized and lack a scientific basis.
  • Healthcare professionals are equipped to manage HMPV cases.
“Most cases of HMPV are mild, but the virus can cause severe respiratory illness.” - Dr. Ranga Reddy Burri

Dr. Burri, the president of the Infection Control Academy of India, is an experienced physician known for his involvement in healthcare education and management.
newTitle: Hyderabad Doctor Addresses HMPV Concerns Amid China Outbreak

title: 'A bit of theatre': Pat Cummins praises Virat Kohli for adding drama to rivalry - The Times of India
summary:
'A bit of theatre': Pat Cummins praises Virat Kohli for adding drama to rivalry

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

After a victorious match in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy final, Australian captain Pat Cummins commended Virat Kohli for his performances and the dramatic element he brings to their rivalry.

  • Pat Cummins praised Kohli's contributions to the game and noted the excitement his presence brings.
  • Cummins mentioned that competition against Kohli has always felt like theatre, contributing to the game's drama.
  • India lost the Border-Gavaskar Trophy series to Australia after a decade with a final score of 1-3.
  • Kohli had a challenging series, finishing with 190 runs in nine innings, including one century.
“It’s always been a wonderful contest. Yeah, I think more than just the runs that he brings to the game, it’s always a bit about a theatre...” - Pat Cummins

Overall, Cummins expressed that Kohli's presence in cricket is significant, and it would be disappointing if this series marked the end of his career.
newTitle: 'A bit of theatre': Pat Cummins praises Virat Kohli for adding drama to rivalry

title: What's so special about SpaceX's first orbital launch of 2025 - NewsBytes
summary:
What's so special about SpaceX's first orbital launch of 2025

Date: Recent
Source: NewsBytes

SpaceX has achieved a significant milestone by successfully launching its first Falcon 9 rocket of 2025, delivering the Thuraya 4 satellite into geosynchronous orbit.

  • The launch took place at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station in Florida.
  • Thuraya 4 will provide mobile communication services across Europe, Africa, and the Middle East.
  • Falcon 9 booster returned successfully, marking its 20th flight.
  • This mission highlights SpaceX's ambition for a busy year with many launches planned.
“The technologies on board will unlock innovative AI-powered services.” - Ali Al Hashemi, CEO of Yahsat Space Services

This launch reinforces SpaceX's leadership in space technology and its capability of integrating AI in satellite operations.
newTitle: SpaceX's Milestone First Orbital Launch of 2025

title: PM inaugurates Delhi section of RRTS; Meerut to be accessible in 40 minutes - The Hindu
summary:
PM inaugurates Delhi section of RRTS; Meerut to be accessible in 40 minutes

Date & Source: January 05, 2025 - The Hindu

Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated a 13-km-long section of the Rapid Rail Transit System (RRTS) on January 5, 2025, connecting Delhi and Meerut, significantly reducing travel time for commuters.

  • The section is between New Ashok Nagar in Delhi and Sahibabad in Uttar Pradesh.
  • Travel time from New Ashok Nagar to Meerut South is now under 40 minutes.
  • Train service frequency is set at 15 minutes starting from 5 p.m. on inauguration day.
  • The fare from New Ashok Nagar to Meerut South is ₹150 for standard and ₹225 for premium coaches.
  • Foundation stone for the project was laid by Modi in March 2019.
“This project is a ₹30,000-crore initiative that will enhance connectivity.”

The inauguration of this section marks a significant advancement in Delhi's transportation infrastructure, promoting ease of travel between the capital and Meerut.
newTitle: PM inaugurates Delhi section of RRTS; Meerut to be accessible in 40 minutes

summary:

  • Two staff members have been arrested following allegations made by female students.

title: How the humble fruit fly transformed research on genes, tissue, disease & evolution - ThePrint
summary:
How the Humble Fruit Fly Transformed Research in Genetics and Beyond

Publication Date: 2023-10-04 | Source: The Conversation

The common fruit fly, or Drosophila melanogaster, has been a pivotal species in scientific research for over a century, leading to significant discoveries in genetics, disease control, and evolution.

  • The fruit fly originates from the woodlands of south-central Africa and has a unique association with human communities.
  • It is extensively used in genetics research, having contributed to foundational discoveries about genes and chromosomes.
  • The species plays a vital role in understanding tissue damage and regeneration, particularly in cancer research.
  • It has contributed to disease control efforts, specifically in combating diseases like dengue through the use of Wolbachia bacteria.
  • Fruit flies are also used to study evolutionary processes, especially in the conservation of threatened species.
“Drosophila melanogaster has contributed to our well-being. Perhaps admire it rather than reaching for that can of fly spray.”

The humble fruit fly is much more than a nuisance; it has profoundly impacted various fields of research and continues to be an invaluable tool for scientists.
newTitle: How the Humble Fruit Fly Transformed Research in Genetics and Beyond

title: 'A lot of flu out there': Winter wave of respiratory illnesses spark concern across the US; here's what t - The Times of India
summary:
'A Lot of Flu Out There': Winter Wave of Respiratory Illnesses Spark Concern Across the US

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Flu season has intensified in the US, leading to a surge in respiratory infections including flu, Covid-19, and RSV. Recent data indicates widespread illness across 40 states, raising alarms from health authorities.

  • Flu, Covid-19, and RSV infections are overlapping and causing significant symptoms across the population.
  • The CDC reports increased hospitalization rates due to these respiratory illnesses.
  • Vaccination coverage for flu, Covid-19, and RSV remains inadequate.
  • Children and older adults are particularly affected, with rising hospitalization rates.
“A lot of flu out there,” - Carrie Reed, CDC

This winter wave of respiratory illnesses highlights ongoing public health challenges as vaccine coverage remains low and respiratory viruses continue to spread.
newTitle: 'A Lot of Flu Out There': Concerns Rise Over Winter Wave of Respiratory Illnesses in the US

In response to PM Modi's remarks during the inauguration of the RRTS project, Kejriwal emphasized that such projects would not have been launched without AAP's cooperation with the Central government.

  • Kejriwal condemns Modi's attacks as politically motivated abuse against AAP.
  • Modi's address was criticized for predominately focusing on AAP rather than inaugurating projects.

“PM Modi is abusing the people of Delhi every day, he is insulting the people of Delhi. People will give a befitting reply to him in the election.” - Arvind Kejriwal

title: Sunil Gavaskar Unhappy He Wasn't Called To Hand Over BGT to Australia: 'Just Because I'm Indian…' - News18
summary:
Sunil Gavaskar Unhappy He Wasn't Called To Hand Over BGT to Australia: 'Just Because I'm Indian…'

Date: January 05, 2025, Source: News18

India cricket legend Sunil Gavaskar expressed his disappointment at not being invited to present the Border-Gavaskar Trophy to Australia after their victory. The trophy was awarded after Australia won the series 3-1 against India.

  • Gavaskar was present at the match but was not included in the trophy presentation.
  • Australia secured the series title for the first time since 2017.
  • Gavaskar commented on the significance of the trophy, which honors both Australian and Indian cricket.
  • Despite the loss, Gavaskar acknowledged the strong relationship he shares with Allan Border.
“I certainly would have loved to have been there for the presentation... Just because I am an Indian, I did not present the trophy.” - Sunil Gavaskar

Gavaskar feels honored that the iconic series between India and Australia is named after him and Border, highlighting their friendship and the spirit of cricket.
newTitle: Sunil Gavaskar Unhappy He Wasn't Called To Hand Over BGT to Australia: 'Just Because I'm Indian…'

title: Healthcare research links loneliness to morbidity and mortality - The Week
summary:
Healthcare research links loneliness to morbidity and mortality

Date: October 2023 | Source: University of Cambridge, Fudan University

This article discusses a study published in the journal Nature Human Behaviour indicating a correlation between loneliness and increased morbidity and mortality, emphasizing its significance as a public health concern.

  • The study analyzed data from over 40,000 participants, identifying genetic correlations between loneliness, depression, and social isolation.
  • Loneliness can significantly affect mental and physical health, impacting sleep, cognition, and cardiovascular health.
  • The World Health Organization estimates that 1 in 4 older adults experience social isolation.
  • Loneliness is comparable to well-known health risk factors like smoking and obesity regarding its impact on mortality.
  • Experts urge for improved psychosocial support and mental health awareness.
“Loneliness has been negatively associated with multiple health outcomes, including mental and physical health, sleep, cognition and cardiovascular health.” - Researchers from Psychiatry Research

This research highlights the urgent need to address loneliness as a growing public health issue, particularly amid the UN Decade of Healthy Ageing (2021-2030).
newTitle: Study Links Loneliness to Increased Health Risks

title: Delhi News Live Updates: Citing CAG report accessed by The Indian Express, PM Modi slams Kejriwal over money spent on ‘Sheesh Mahal’ - The Indian Express
summary:
Delhi News Live Updates: CAQM Revokes GRAP 3 as Air Quality Improves

Date: 2024-12-01 Source: The Indian Express

The Commission for Air Quality Management (CAQM) in the NCR has revoked the Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP) Stage III, citing improvements in air quality.

  • The AQI improved and was reported at 339 in the 'very poor' category.
  • AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal criticized PM Modi for his speech during a recent rally.
  • Kejriwal highlighted unfulfilled promises made by the PM during the 2020 assembly elections.
  • PM Modi mocked AAP for focus on luxury renovations at the CM's residence, citing reports on costs.
  • PM Modi inaugurated a section of the Delhi-Meerut RRTS corridor prior to the rally.
“The PM spoke for 38 minutes today. Of these, he spent around 29 minutes abusing the people of Delhi...” - Arvind Kejriwal

This development marks a significant move by the CAQM amidst ongoing concerns about air quality in Delhi, while the political landscape continues to be heated.
newTitle: Delhi News Live Updates: CAQM Revokes GRAP 3 as Air Quality Improves

title: Foreign investors pull out Rs 4,285 crore from Indian equities amid high valuations, global headwinds - The Times of India
AI to companies is like fridge to Coca-Cola — Investor Vijay Kedia shares interesting analogy | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
AI to companies is like fridge to Coca-Cola — Investor Vijay Kedia shares interesting analogy

Date: January 5, 2025 | Source: Live Mint

Kedia draws a parallel between the impact of AI and the invention of refrigerators, emphasizing that AI will empower users, much like refrigerators empowered beverage giants.

“Just as the invention of fridges enabled Pepsi and Coca-Cola to dominate globally, AI will empower users to create and innovate. The true beneficiaries of AI will be those who harness its potential, not just the developers.” — Vijay Kedia
  • Kedia states that every company will need to adopt AI as a tool for efficiency.
  • He argues that AI will have a wide-reaching impact on all industries that utilize software.
  • Netizens are engaging with his perspective on social media, highlighting different views on using AI effectively.

Overall, the analogy suggests that the future of businesses leveraging AI will be much like the market dominance of Pepsi and Coca-Cola in their industry.

summary:
Akshay Kumar to Star in Stree 3 as 'Thanos' of Maddock Horror-Comedy Universe

Date: January 05, 2025, Source: News18

Akshay Kumar's return to the Maddock Films' horror-comedy universe has been confirmed for Stree 3, with Dinesh Vijan humorously referring to him as the 'Thanos' of the franchise.

  • Akshay's cameo in Stree 2 was highly successful, helping it become the highest-grossing Bollywood film of all time.
  • The upcoming Stree 3 is set for release on August 13, 2025.
  • Akshay hinted at his role by stating, “Dinesh and Jyoti will have to decide that they’re the ones to pump in the money.”
  • Dinesh Vijan confirmed Akshay’s involvement, saying, “Of course, he’s a part of the universe! He’s our Thanos.”
  • Stree 2 starred Rajkummar Rao and Shraddha Kapoor, earning over Rs 600 crore in India.
“Of course, he’s a part of the universe! He’s our Thanos (laughs).” - Dinesh Vijan

title: US Surgeon General calls for cancer warnings on alcohol - Deccan Herald
summary:
US Surgeon General Calls for Cancer Warnings on Alcohol

Published: 05 January 2025
Source: Bloomberg News

Alcoholic beverages should carry cancer warnings, according to US Surgeon General Vivek Murthy, highlighting the alarming lack of public awareness regarding the health risks associated with alcohol consumption.

  • Less than 50% of Americans are aware that alcohol increases cancer risks.
  • Alcohol is responsible for approximately 100,000 cancer cases and 20,000 related deaths annually in the US.
  • The introduction of cancer warnings on alcoholic drinks could redirect attention to serious health risks known for decades.
  • The American Medical Association supports the call for updated warning labels.
  • A global issue, with 741,300 cancer cases attributed to alcohol consumption worldwide in 2020.
“alcohol consumption at any level, not just heavy alcohol use or addictive alcohol use, is a modifiable risk factor for cancer” - AMA President Bruce Scott

The Surgeon General's advisory aims to enhance awareness of alcohol-related health risks and foster better public health policies regarding alcohol consumption.
newTitle: US Surgeon General Calls for Cancer Warnings on Alcohol

title: Virat Kohli does not deserve place in team, need to end superstar culture: Irfan Pathan - Deccan Herald
summary:
Irfan Pathan Critiques Virat Kohli's Place in the Indian Team

Published: 05 January 2025, Source: Star Sports

Sydney: Former cricketer Irfan Pathan has expressed concerns regarding Virat Kohli's performance and commitment to domestic cricket, suggesting it may be time to replace him in the team.

  • Pathan criticized Kohli for not playing domestic matches and for technical flaws in his game.
  • During the recent Test series against Australia, Kohli scored only 190 runs in nine innings.
  • Pathan advocates for ending superstar culture, emphasizing team over individual capabilities.
  • He pointed out that Kohli hasn’t played a first-class match since 2012.
  • Pathan believes Kohli's consistent errors indicate a lack of seriousness in improving his game.
“We need to end superstar culture, we need team culture. It’s about the team, not the individuals.”
newTitle: Irfan Pathan Critiques Virat Kohli's Place in the Indian Team

title: "Retirement In Your Hands, Playing For India Is Not": Rohit Sharma Served Big Warning - NDTV Sports
summary:
Retirement In Your Hands, Playing For India Is Not: Rohit Sharma Served Big Warning

Publication Date: January 5, 2025

Source: NDTV Sports

In a recent interview, Rohit Sharma discussed his cricketing future amid speculations of his retirement, clarifying that while retirement is a personal decision, his place in the team will ultimately be determined by the selectors.

  • Sanjay Manjrekar emphasizes that while players can decide on retirement, performance determines team selection.
  • Rohit has opted out of the latest Test match due to poor form and expresses that he won't retire soon.
  • Manjrekar notes the impact of selectors' choices on players' careers, highlighting a respect for hierarchy in the selection process.
“Retirement is in your hands, but playing for India is not,” Sanjay Manjrekar stated.

The conversation sheds light on the balancing act of personal ambitions versus team requirements in professional sports.
newTitle: Rohit Sharma's Future in Indian Cricket: A Candid Discussion

title: Leopard, three tigers die of Avian flu in Maharashtra’s Gorewada Rescue Centre - The Hindu
summary:
Leopard, three tigers die of Avian flu in Maharashtra’s Gorewada Rescue Centre

Published Date: January 05, 2025
Source: The Hindu

Four animals, including three tigers and a leopard, have died due to H5N1 Avian Influenza at the Gorewada Rescue Centre in Nagpur, Maharashtra. A red alert has been issued by the Government of India to prepare zoos across the state for potential outbreaks.

This tragic event has triggered enhanced bio-security measures to prevent further infections among animals and protect staff.

  • Three tigers and one leopard died from H5N1 Avian Influenza.
  • Red alert issued by the Government of India for preparedness in all zoos.
  • Veterinarians released a detailed protocol to prevent bird access to animal enclosures.
  • Symptoms observed in animals included limping, diarrhoea, and fever.
  • Advisories aim to minimize AI transmission risk and ensure rapid containment.
“H5N1 is a lethal virus but other variants may not be this lethal, and animals can be saved on timely treatment,” - Shatanik Bhagwat, Divisional Manager, Gorewada Project.

The ongoing situation stresses the need for vigilance and safety protocols in wildlife facilities to combat the spread of Avian Influenza.
newTitle: Leopard and Tigers Die from Avian Flu in Maharashtra Rescue Centre

title: Delhi Assembly elections 2025: Prime Minister Narendra Modi addresses parivartan rally in Rohini in New Delhi - The Hindu
summary:
Delhi Assembly elections 2025: Prime Minister Narendra Modi addresses parivartan rally in Rohini in New Delhi

Prime Minister Narendra Modi addressed a rally in Rohini, New Delhi, highlighting the achievements of the BJP and inviting voters to reject the ruling AAP government in the upcoming assembly elections.

  • Inauguration of the Janakpuri West-Krishna Park Extension section of Delhi Metro’s Phase IV.
  • Foundation stone laid for the 26.5 km Rithala-Kundli corridor, enhancing connectivity.
  • Modi criticized the AAP government for mismanagement and promised no welfare schemes would be cut under BJP.
  • Emphasized the need for change in governance to improve Delhi's infrastructure.
“Only when this ‘aapda (disaster)’ is gotten rid of in Delhi, the double-engine of development will come.” - Prime Minister Narendra Modi

Modi’s rally sought to generate support for the BJP by focusing on past grievances under AAP, presenting the BJP as a catalyst for positive change in Delhi.
newTitle: PM Modi Addresses Rally in Rohini Ahead of Delhi Assembly Elections 2025

PM Modi Criticizes AAP Government in Delhi

Prime Minister Narendra Modi addresses crowd in Delhi, criticizing the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) for lacking a vision for the city’s development and inaugurating several key infrastructure projects ahead of elections.

  • PM Modi inaugurated the Namo Bharat rapid transit train corridor, worth ₹12,000 crores.

  • Criticized AAP, calling it a ‘punishment’ for residents.
  • New Delhi to have rapid transit connectivity and an extension of the Magenta Line.
  • Delhi Metro projects worth over ₹6,230 crores were laid as foundation stones.

title: Box Office: Allu Arjun's Pushpa 2 Becomes Highest Grossing Film in India Overtaking Baahubali 2 - PINKVILLA
summary:
Pushpa 2 Becomes Highest Grossing Film in India Overtaking Baahubali 2

Publication Date: January 05, 2025 | Source: Pinkvilla

Pushpa 2 has officially dethroned Baahubali 2 as the highest-grossing film in India, achieving a total gross of Rs. 1,352 crore.

  • Pushpa 2 grossed Rs. 1345 crore at the Indian box office after five Saturdays.
  • It is part of a group of over twenty films that have reached the highest-grossing title in India's box office history.
  • The film's success was significantly bolstered in the Hindi-speaking belt of India.
  • The previous record-holder, Baahubali 2, held the title for over seven years.
“It took 7 years, 8 months and 3 days for a film to finally dethrone Baahubali 2 as the highest-grossing film in India and that film is Pushpa 2.”

Pushpa 2's rise to the top is a remarkable feat in Indian cinema, affirming its cultural and financial impact within the film industry.
newTitle: Pushpa 2 Becomes Highest Grossing Film in India

title: Allu Arjun's Pushpa 2 Becomes Highest Grossing Film in India Overtaking Baahubali 2 - PINKVILLA
summary:
Pushpa 2 Becomes India's Highest Grossing Film, Surpassing Baahubali 2

Updated on: January 05, 2025 | Source: Pinkvilla

Pushpa 2 has dethroned Baahubali 2 as the highest-grossing film in India after nearly 8 years. The film grossed Rs. 1,352 crore at the box office, surpassing the previous record.

  • Pushpa 2 grossed Rs. 6 crore on its fifth Saturday, bringing its total to Rs. 1,345 crore.
  • Allu Arjun's performance and the film's appeal in the Hindi belt contributed significantly to its success.
  • It is one of over twenty films that have held the title of highest-grosser in Indian cinema history.
  • The history of box office records includes early films like Kismet (1943) and Mother India (1957).
“It took 7 years, 8 months and 3 days for a film to finally dethrone Baahubali 2 as the highest-grossing film in India.”

Pushpa 2's achievement highlights the evolving landscape of Indian cinema and the growing dominance of regional films in the mainstream box office.
newTitle: Pushpa 2 Becomes India's Highest Grossing Film, Surpassing Baahubali 2
